metadata.title: CVE-2019-1999 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In binder_alloc_free_page of binder_alloc.c, there is a possible doublefree due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege in the kernel with no additional execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android.Versions: Android kernel. Android ID: A-120025196.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
No subscription required
